As you approach, it suddenly becomes apparent something is deathly awry. Blaring sirens fill the air as distant blots of color scurry about on the surface. Distant laser fire can be heard as the shadow of a massive black object moves closer to the distant palace, trailed by the ruins of what was once the Dynasty's finest fleet.
Approach the ship.

Looks like it's an Auto-ship... and far larger than usual. As soon as you enter its scanning range, it speaks. "It is advisable you leave. I do not aim to kill you. Not today. My batteries are better spent testing out my chassis on some easy targets. Leave, and I will kill you another day instead. That is my promise." Oddly well spoken for a robot...
Let's teach this hunk of metal some manners.
"Unadvisable decision. Your failure will be my pleasure. You are aware the odds are massively against you? Regardless... you will die here."
Continue...
Bide this peculiar warning and leave.
"A wise decision. If only my superiors could listen to me in such a manner."
This is as good a time as any to leave.
This isn't a good place for a Federation ship to be. You owe nothing to the Dynasty - you aren't going to waste valuable time saving them from whatever latest monstrosity the Rebellion has cooked up.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

You land on the planet's surface, briefly considering salvaging some of the Dynasty wrecks before a massive Dynasty cruiser flies by and lands next to yours. Out of it steps several Alphas and a pink Ghost wearing armor and wielding a massive sword. If you had to take a guess, this would be the Prime Reaper, the ancestral leader of the Dynasty.
Continue...

The Reaper begins to speak, but you can't understand a word he says. You realize you left your translator back on the ship, but before you can run and get it the Reaper waves you back and presses a button on his armor. "The demon's heart is perished! Who art thou, and for what reasonings have you come to bless us with this?"
I go by no name.

"Mysterious! Intriguing. Most intriguing. Are you always this cryptic? I hope so! I am Dessius, son of Adotious, 16th Prime Reaper of the Spectral Dynasty. You have saved our people, no name. I am inclined to like you because of that. Long after the terror of the Obelisk have we feared another invasion might bring our climatic end, and today the demon almost got his wish. Until you arrived, that is!"
The who?

"The Obelisk. One of 5 ancient empires that ruled the galaxy so long ago your kind have no memories of their rule. I cannot blame your ignorance, those foul cuboids were but their own cause of destruction. A god complex does no good, especially not if you wield tech capable of ripping holes through space time. But enough of them. They're dead, much unlike us today! At last, we see the end of the foul demons. Their kind shall plague us no more!"
The Rebel AI is kept on the Flagship, not that Dreadnaught.

"You are to say... that was not the demon's heart? Then we shall continue to teeter on the brink of imminent doom unless this monster can be brought to ultimate peace! But, my not-present ears detect the faintest slivers of hope in your breath. You say, you know the location of the heart? The true source of our sufferings? Then I must go in attendance. In our wake shall remain not one demon's twitching coniver that we have not sent to the gallows!"
Continue...

"Oh, but before we depart, I find it imperative that we prepare for the travels ahead. It is clear to me now the Federation is no longer a threat. I shall deliver but my finest war vessels to their lands so that they too may vanquish the Rebel threat that terrorizes us all! As for you my friend, let us see what not we can help you with."
An unvisited location.
This beacon contains ancient ruins.
You've heard that the Dynasty's territory is littered with ruins from days past. But the wrecks in the distance... well, those don't look like Dynasty ships to you.

Should I even continue to persist in this reality after?"

The Phantom sighs. "Your barbaric vernacular singes my tongue, but yes, I shall put an attempt to communicate in a way your primitive ape brain might understand. This beacon is the last of the great Obelisk wastes in this sector that require cleansing. This task was left up to Salvaging Operation DN-03. All objects or artifacts collected here are to be brought back for processing. We request that you leave, and warn you that our vessels are armed for combat as well as they are prepared for collection of ancient rubbish."

"Ooh, you are a foul creature! How the anger and thoughts of violence twist your face into an unpleasant swirl of unconditional hatred. Erasing you shall do all but yourself a favor."

The most reliable way to help the smugglers is simply to blow these Ghosts up. Hopefully should be easy enough.
Continue...
Bribe the checkpoint.
"For what is this generous donation? Hark? To turn a back to the security of this beacon for the next 5 hours? Well, I do suppose this is a deal we can arrange."
Continue...
You hail the smugglers, letting them know it's safe. "A bribe? How boring, I was looking for some damn fireworks! But, I'm a man of my word. Sometimes. Right now I am. But not always. Here you go."
Sell them the location of the smugglers.
You doubt the Smugglers are going to give you a weapon after this, but it was effortless scrap and who can complain about that?
(Savior of the Dynasty) Could you do us a favor?

"Oh the gods bestow upon me an honor like I never knew! An embarassment, I am, for not having recognized the savior of our lands! Yes, yes, we will do anything!" You kindly ask them to allow your smuggler 'friends' through, and they oblige without hesitation.
Continue...
You hail the smugglers, letting them know it's safe. "Hah, what was that? I was looking for some damn fireworks! But, I'm a man of my word. Sometimes. Right now I am. But not always. Here you go."
Fight the smugglers instead.
You don't make deals with pirates, but you'll gladly fight them instead!
Continue...
We aren't going to work for some smugglers.
You somewhat rudely decline the smugglers' offer and fly away.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

Almost immediately, you receive a hail from what appears to be an Auto-station lingering nearby. "Hello. This is a prerecorded message for all nearby non-Dynasty vessels. The nearby settlement of Ghosts has proven problematic for the Rebellion. Recapture it, and this platform is authorized to reward you with a drone."
Attack the Ghosts.

It feels weird working for the Rebellion, but you can't think of anything more satisfyingly ironic than using their own weapon against them. Assuming you succeed, of course. As you approach the colony, one of their vessels rises to face you.
Continue...
Just destroy the Auto.
It means you won't get the weapon, but it's much easier just to kill this Auto-station than to go fight a Dynasty colony. Plus, it means not working for the Rebellion!
Continue...
Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.
You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

You notice the shadow of a ship slipping through the nebulas behind you, and begin to fear it might be following you, until it comes bursting out of the clouds, revealing itself to be a Dynasty vessel. Their weapons are off however, and their comms are open for communication.
Continue...

"We have identified you as a Multiverse Renegade vessel. Does this statement hold true? If so, we suspect you are not opposed to matters of mercenary work. A ship of automated nature but Zoltan origins has been spotted dangerously close to a loyal Dynasty colony. While these do not pose the same threat as a Rebel vessel, it could create hysteria of immense proportions amongst our citizens. Could you disable it?"
Chase down the Auto-ship.
Decline.
"Then you are of no use to us. Furthermore, you are trespassing on Dynasty territory, and must be removed."
Continue...

"Federation vessel registered entering combat proximity. Forwarding data collection to Ministry." Guess your crime won't go unnoticed by the Zoltan, but they're too far away right now to do anything about it. First, you have to take out this auto.
Continue...
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."
Continue...
(Upg. Weapons) Threaten them.

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."

(Upg. Weapons) Threaten them.

"I most often discard the mercenaries I first hire to do dirty work, but I admire your willingness to cooperate. Though my superiors would cry to the heavens at this sin, I shall slide you a parcel of scrap in exchange for your efforts."

From the depths of the clouds approaches a Dynasty ship, their captain speaking in a soft whisper of static. "Please aid us... we are no longer of the mind to take part in the Reaper's war. I desire an outing. May I desert to your ship?" Before you can even consider responding, you notice a quick blur of motion in the distance. Looks like the deserters are being followed.
Turn in the deserters.
Allow the Ghost onto the crew.
Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.
You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
Continue...
Looks like the deserters have already given up. They hardly even protest as they are handed over to the other ship. The loyal Dynasty ship thanks you, and offers a reward.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.

You quickly usher the Ghost crew aboard, and by some miracle it appears you weren't spotted. You quickly fly away with your new crew aboard.

You notice an unusual amount of static over your radio. You play with it a bit until suddenly your translator switches on and begins to spit out dialogue from a Dynasty ship concealed nearby. "We are but hopelessly disoriented, you brainless bobolyne!" "Oh close thine mouth, you worthless bespawler. We have no brains, we are but gas! This senseless debauchery of the insults will present us no solution."
Offer to escort them.

"Oh, Reaper's sweet travesty, you are Federation! We shall take no 'help' from you, fiend!" This wasn't the reaction you expected, but if you can force them into surrendering perhaps they'll finally be willing to take your help?
Continue...
(Ghost Crew) Offer to escort them.
"Oh, but speak not further! For it seems a fellow is offering us their most charitable aid. Many thanks, good friend. We shan't let this favor go forgotten."
Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.
You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

Your computer is suddenly flooded with alerts from nearby Dynasty security platforms. You listen to the static as your translator struggles to pick out something discernable from pure noise. "Avast! Turn thine's spirits away from this place and take content in safety not to be found here."
Hail one of the stations.

You assume they'll simply ignore you, but to your surprise a Phantom appears on the other end. "Oh? Have the maniacal hands of the lingering demon not yet snatched you away from this plane? Then consider yourself lucky, and take this chance to flee. You would be no coward to do such a thing..."
What monster?
"A most horrible demon! It haunts these grounds, it ravages our colonies and it displaces our supplies! Oh flee, oh flee, for it shall strike you too if you stay!"
We shall help! Fight the horrible demon.
You pilot further into the nebula, preparing yourself mentally for whatever monstrous ship lies ahead. At last, you lay eyes on it... and it's not really what you expected.
Continue...
We should go.
Take this warning and leave.
Sounds like there's something bad going on here - it's only safe to turn tail and run.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

You follow the signal of the distress call to what looks to be... an abandoned Engineer vessel? The crew are nowhere to be found, but there's signs of a struggle, and the air is thick with the putrid scent of Ghosts.
Try and track down the Engineers.

Exploring the nearby system leads you to a Dynasty station with several ships docked. Inside several Ghosts are jeering as one of the engineers is escorted towards a guillotine device with a shimmering electrified blade. They spot you and give you a pleading glance, silently begging you to help them.
Aid the engineer.
You draw your blaster and shoot the guard escorting the engineer, followed by the execution machine itself. You run out of the room followed by the wounded engineer as angry Ghosts rush towards you!
Continue...
We aren't helping Rebels. Leave.
Stay safe and hang back to scrap their ship.
With no one to stop you, you pull apart the hull of the engineer vessel and bring it back aboard.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."
Continue...

It's strange how aggressive the Dynasty is, especially when the break away vagabond Ghosts are much more reclusive. Though, perhaps that may be why they broke away in the first place. But, you'll have to think about this later, as a Dynasty vessel is inbound!
Make no mistake, the ship coming at you isn't friendly. A Dynasty vessel lurches forward, eyeing your weapons before attacking!
A garbled message comes across your radio. "Weapons. They belong to me. GIVE!" A Dynasty ship uncloaks nearby, weapons drawn!
For such an elegant name as the Spectral Dynasty, their ships are uncharacteristically hostile and violent. There's no better example than the vessel here, as it approaches menacingly.
A shot flies right past your ship, and seconds later a purple vessel comes drifting out of the clouds. Looks like it's Ghosts... and they don't look friendly!

A bloodchilling scream fills your speakers, followed by unsettling static. Any captain with lesser nerves might have fainted on the spot, but you know better. This isn't some demon, this is a much more real threat. A Dynasty vessel approaches!

Looks like you're receiving a short range broadcast. "Your flesh shall appease the demon's heart one more day. Your weapons shall be its destruction! For the good of the Dynasty!" A Ghost vessel appears nearby, weapons drawn and already firing!

An unsettling chant echoes through the nebula as a ship approaches. "The demon's heart shall cease! The demon's heart shall cease!", followed by the flashing of gunfire as a Dynasty vessel draws near. Are you the demon? You aren't sure, but you won't have time to ask!

In light of the seemingly empty nebula, you make conversation with the crew on enemies you could have found here instead. As soon as one of them mentions the Dynasty, a ship comes barreling out of the nebula, as if it were summoned. Speak of the devil...

At first you assume the static over the radio to be nonsense, but suddenly your translator starts to pick up words! "A breather! In Dynasty space, how putrid. It turns my insides into coils of anger. I will unleash hell on you scum!"
Continue...
The Vagabonds usually just avoid Dynasty space, not worth the risk. This ship must be desperate - desperate enough to attack you!
Looks like you aren't safe from the scrap hungry Vagabonds, even in Dynasty space where they try to so hard to repel them. Prepare for combat.
You notice a Vagabond ship nearby watching you hungrily. "In my heart I feel the desire of a new vessel... this one is depreciated and has failed its function..." The Ghosts attack!

A Vagabond, likely fleeing from Dynasty patrols, has stumbled right into you. "You side with the Dynasty, nay? Oh, for what am I asking. The risk is not worth it, I shall simply remove you from my path."
Continue...
Usually the Rebel ships you'd expect to see here are Autos, but it's not surprising to see an Engineer here either. Unfortunately, they're no less friendly either!
"You've just come here to make my damn job harder, haven't you? Piss off!" A particularly agitated Engineer vessel swerves to attack you!
After a long day working on the always damaged Auto-ships they construct, it's no wonder the Engineers feel the need to let off some steam. Alas, it looks like you're their next target!
"Oh come on! I haven't even finished my lunch break! You picked the wrong time to ruin my day, asshole!" Hostiles inbound!
Could it be? A Rebel ship? Your eyes aren't lying to you - and this is no ordinary Rebel. It's an Engineer, but they're no less deadly!
Continue...

The Dynasty has been waging 'war' against the Auto-ships for a long time now. How the Rebels are able to afford such a massive stream of ships - or why Vance approved it - is a mystery to you, but it's only a hopefully minor inconvenience to you.
"You are not father. Father is not as ugly as you. Entering combat mode." The nearby Rebel Auto-ship suddenly activates and attacks!

You assume this to be an empty beacon... until you notice the dozens of dormant Auto-ships floating through the nebulas. You try to avoid them, but unfortunately it looks like one of them has noticed you and attacks!
You practically bump hulls with a Rebel Auto-ship, but it's too late to slip away before it's already noticed you and started to attack!
Curse the Rebels and their massive fleet of Auto-ships at constant disposal. Looks like you have another ship to take care of before you can carry on.
The Dynasty will probably be pleased to hear of your path of destruction through all of the Auto-ships you see. But before you can brag, you have another ship to add to your kill count.
Continue...

"OooooOoOh, so you've come to interfere? A royally immense pain in the end the Federation is proving to be!" An agitated Dynasty vessel attacks as soon as you enter. Behind them is an unidentified ship they must have been interrogating before this!

The Dynasty normally doesn't take prisoners, but it seems they haven't gotten the desired reaction from the unidentified ship behind them, as you can hear the agitation in the shouting Ghost captain's voice. As soon as you enter the system however, his concentration focuses on you!
Looks like two ships are here - one of unidentified origin, and the other Dynasty. The Dynasty ship doesn't seem to want you around, because they attack almost immediately!

Looks like the victim was just some civilians. "Thanks for the help. Is nowhere safe anymore? I chose to come here over a trip through the Hive, but it might have been safer the other way around. My ship is ruined. I think I'll come with you."
Looks like the ship was little more than a damaged Auto. Beyond the point of repair, it's best just to scrap it.

It appears the Dynasty ship's victim was a Rebel vessel! They put on a tough appearance, but it's clear to you that they're thankful. It's not hard convincing them to lie to the fleet about your location.

Scans are turning up something large on the nearby lava planet. Looks like it's a massive Dynasty class-F Dreadnaught! Completely trashed of course, it'll probably never fly again... but that hasn't stopped a horde of Vagabonds from taking residence.
You jump out of your seat, prepared to fight the wreck drifting at this beacon, but it's no Ghost ship. You scrap whats left.
You're ready to fight, but the wreck here is silent. Its crew are dead, and their attacker long gone. You cautiously scrap the ship.
A wrecked ship inhabits this beacon. You scan it for Ghosts, but all results show the ship is empty. You figure it's safe to salvage what you can.
Whoever destroyed the ship at this beacon doesn't matter, but it must not have been the Ghosts. Empty of all crew, you move in to scrap it.

Scans are turning up something large on the nearby lava planet. Looks like it's a massive Dynasty class-F Dreadnaught! Completely trashed of course, it'll probably never fly again... but that hasn't stopped a horde of Vagabonds from taking residence.
Try to scrap some of the outer regions of the ship.
Hail the Ghosts.
The crackling static through your stereo eventually shifts into discernable words. "This place of ours we call home is not for the Federation's taking. We will trade, if you have missiles."
Give them some missiles to access a store.
Ignore their request and scrap the wreck.
"You are a person of terrible motivations, and I shall kill you swiftly." An elite Ghost ship flies out of the wreck to meet you.
Continue...
Decline and leave.
Avoid the wreck.
That's not a wreck-site anymore, it's a home to probably a couple dozen Ghosts. Best not to intrude on their space.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
You're pretty certain the Ghosts spot you multiple times, but never once do they try and stop you. Maybe they're just very understanding?
It doesn't take long for the Ghosts to spot you... one ship flies out to match you. Looks like it was an elite, but now it's in the hands of the Ghosts!
Continue...

Not sure. Could you describe one?
"Well, they're of green hue. And have the nature of a nebula. That's really it."
Lie and say you've heard about them.
"Really?! I am amazed! Please, please, you must tell me where!"
Make up some coordinates.

"Ooooh, ooooh! I must head there at once! Thank you for your assistance, oh seer of those things which beg of being seen!"
Tell the truth. You've never seen one.
"That's alright! Had we explorers seen all the starry sky had to be seen, why then there would be nothing left to be an explorer OF! Safe travels friend, and may this aid you."
(Adv. Sensors) Offer him your detailed map data.

Domodius takes a look at the data you've given him. "Hmmm. Inconclusive. Still, this proves you are a purveyor of fine knowledge and a keen explorer with an eye for discovery! If I join you, our combined intellect should be unrivaled!"
(Long Range Scanners) Offer him your detailed map data.

Domodius takes a look at the data you've given him. "Hmmm. Inconclusive. Still, this proves you are a purveyor of fine knowledge and a keen explorer with an eye for discovery! If I join you, our combined intellect should be unrivaled!"

Aenwithe explains that acid nebulas don't come from this reality, or any others like it. This seems to satisfy Domodius. "I have never heard of this... edition of captains you speak of, but it sounds most horrible. I've never been so glad to live in this reality. If you are so knowledgeable, then I shall come with you, so that our combined intellect should know no limits!"
Can't help.
"Oh, a shame! So long then, oh voyager of the interdimensional threads of the cosmos!"
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

"Huh? But I have already been there! I've laid sight on all that system has to offer, but there is no acid nebula to be seen. Had you simply said no there would have been no harm, but lying to me? Unforgivable, I shall not live with such an insult going unmatched!"
Continue...
"Ooooh, ooooh! I must head there at once! Thank you for your assistance, oh seer of those things which beg of being seen!"

The nebula appears empty, but not long after you jump in all of your lights go off. A few seconds later, your main screen flickers to life. You sit back in anticipation, watching the blinking cursor as it begins to type...

Yes, I was very scared.
The screen goes blank, and then a Ghost beams onto the bridge. "Hah! You cause me sensations of joy. That is an emotion I have not felt in many cycles. I think I'll stick with you, breather."
Not really.
The computer shuts off, and a set of Ghosts apparate on the bridge, and make their move towards you. You ready your crew for combat.

Ghost Vagabonds usually inhabit their ship for long periods of time until the damage becomes too major to be ignored. The Ghost ship at this beacon is on its last breath, but unexpectedly the Ghost crew makes no attempt to attack your ship. A quick scan shows why; their weapons are barely functional and the engines are leaking fuel fast.
Easy target, attack!
For once, you're the one initiating the combat. You power up your weapons and prepare to destroy the already-crippled wreck.
Continue...
Pay them scrap to fix up their hull. [-35~]
Ignore the ship.
The Ghosts make no attempt to communicate with you, and eventually slip back into the clouds, leaving you all alone.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
"Your donations are most generous, but they will not be enough to accomodate everyone. This vessel will live another day, but I must seek somewhere new to continue my travels. You will do."

A Slug vessel is already at this beacon, surrounded by several Vagabond ships. Oddly enough, none of the Ghosts are attacking the Slug, nor is the Slug scrapping the wrecks.
Hail them.

The Slug captain responds in a frustrated tone, constantly looking around himself and occasionally turning around to yell at his crew. "Yesss, you're Federation. We're a sssscience vesssel, and we've reccccently taken up trying to breed Ghosssstssss. Turnsss out they don't breed. Ssso..."
Offer to buy one of their test subjects as crew.
(Ghost Crew) Have your Ghost explain Ghost reproduction.

Your Ghost types out its response on a small tablet so that the Slug can understand. According to them, the Ghosts 'age' through the collection of natural gasses they assimilate into their body. Once they reach a maximum size, they become known as an alpha. Once in the alpha stage, they can divide to create a new ghost.
Continue...

"What?! Thissss doesssn't even make sssenssse! Ugh... this busssinessss issssn't the right place for me. You're sssaying thessse big guysss are important? Fine, take one. What point issss there to it anywayssss..."
(Plasma Replicator) Show them the replicator.

The scientist eagerly investigates the device, looking into every crevice and studying every inch. You consider complaining about the slime but don't want to break him from his concentration. After a while he punches the machine, and yells something. "I musst try thissss! How much?"
Sell them the augment.
The Slug can hardly control himself, tossing you the scrap and running off with his latest bounty.
Refuse.
The Slug shouts something insulting about wasting his time, and heads back to his ship in a tizzy.
End the call.
You shrug and end the call. You doubt the scientist minds.

Do nothing.
Ignore them.
Slugs, even scientists, cannot be trusted, nor do you wish to aggravate a clan of Ghosts. You decide to stay at a distance from their shady dealings.

Do nothing.
"You... you want to BUY one of thessse freaksss? Well, can't argue with sssome ssscrap."

Continue...
The Ghosts might not be paranormal, but they sure do put you on edge. You jump when a Vagabond ship comes drifting out of the nebula. Man the stations!
You always find yourself second guessing when you encounter a wreck. You don't have to think about it for very long because the wreck at this beacon moves in to attack you first.

The Vagabonds usually get their ships by stealing them from their victims, but if they encounter an already abandoned ship they'll happily inhabit it. Whichever way they inherited this ship doesn't matter, because it's hostile and moves in to attack.
The wreck at this beacon is no idle ship forgotten amongst the clouds. It's teeming with Ghosts ready to steal your ship.
You've prepared for and experienced all kinds of situations in the Federation, but nothing startles you as much as the Ghost-populated vagabond wrecks that are always oozing out from these clouds.

Your ship receives a hail, but you aren't sure from where. You accept, and a painfully loud static floods the speakers, insulting your bloodline and calling you a 'filthy lung-borne breather'. A Ghost ship approaches, weapons ready!
"I've heard it told our repugnant odor originates from a mixture of mercaptans. Fascinating is it not? Ah, but what truly fascinates me is how you fell for this most clever distraction!"
The Vagabond Ghosts are typically aggressive. A life of anarchy after having abandoned your war-driven native faction does something to a person. Nevertheless, they're a target for you to destroy!
A Slug ship hails you. "Ghosstsssss or not, we don't care. The nebulassss belong to the Kleptocracy and the EHG, not to the Ghossstsss, and ccccertainly not to the Federation!"
Continue...

It looks like a Rebel Auto-ship was exploring this sector, but got lost in the nebulas. Now attempting to return to base before Ghosts can capture it, it raises its weapons to defend itself from you while its FTL drive charges.
Continue...

Lanius aren't common sights in nebula sectors, but they're drawn to the Ghosts. Natural enemies, the Lanius prey on the Ghosts to absorb their ships. The Lanius here don't care that you're not Ghost, and attack regardless.
Continue...
Looks like a Vagabond ship is scanning the nearby gas giant, but quickly hails you when you jump in. "Isn't my darling beautiful?"
Your... who?

"Don't be silly! I know you can see. She's quite large!" It doesn't take long to realize they're referring to the gas planet. "Say, can you do me a favor? My darling hungers! I must feed her. But I lack the food. You must bring me a wreck. I heard a demon lingers about! But, perhaps you'd prefer to go after some Rebels instead..."
Go after the 'demon'.
Looks like the 'demon' in question is... a Rebel Auto-ship? Well, you'll have to kill this thing either way, get ready to fight!
Continue...
Go after the Rebels.
Fortunately, there's a Rebel ship not too far from here. You can pick these guys off pretty easily, you hope.
Continue...
Decline.
"Ok... Say goodbye to the Federation captain, darling!" The gas giant remains silent, swirling in the distance silently judging you.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

"Yes, yes! Oh you are triumphant! My darling shall not go hungry again tonight!" The Ghost links the wreck with his own vessel, then uses it to slingshot the wreckage into the gas giant. The ship spirals away out of visibility as it is consumed by the planet. "Good. You deserve a most generous reward!"

You've become accustomed to not seeing many Fed ships around - so seeing one here comes as quite the shock. Even weirder, their weapons are powered and hull shows some minor damage. They must have just been in combat.
Hail them.

The vessel's captain looks up, distracted. "Huh? Oh! Well, look who it is. I thought we were all alone in these clouds. Save for the Ghosts that is. Was trying to clear out a camp of them not too far from here, bastards are stranded! I can just keep taking trips back and forth as much as I like!"
But why?

"Hah! Well, why not? Easy scrap, and makes the nebulas just a little less crowded. Once the Rebellion is out of way, the Federation will probably move a bit further out, might as well get started clearing out the riff-raff."
Help them clear out the Ghosts.
Your offer to help delights the Federation captain. He leads you to the Ghost camp, where you spot out your target.
Attack one of the Mantis wrecks.
As you move in to attack the Vagabonds, you watch as the other ships move to fight the Federation vessel. Hopefully you can both pull through.
Continue...
Attack one of the Engi wrecks.
As you move in to attack the Vagabonds, you watch as the other ships move to fight the Federation vessel. Hopefully you can both pull through.
Continue...
Attack one of the Zoltan wrecks.
As you move in to attack the Vagabonds, you watch as the other ships move to fight the Federation vessel. Hopefully you can both pull through.
Continue...
That's evil! Attack the Feds.
"Gah! What the hell are you doing?" You mute the vessel and attack.
Continue...
Ignore the ship.
The Federation vessel looks to be too preoccupied to notice or care about you.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

"Good work there! We showed those gas freaks what for-" the Federation ship is cut off as a blast from a Vagabond vessel tears their hull right in half! "Get lost, breather!" You quickly wipe out the second Ghost ship, but the Federation ship won't last much longer.
Save the captain.
"Th-thanks. This is why we've gotta have our backs at the Federation, this galaxy is full of unprovoked dangers!"
It's for the best. Let them die and scrap their ship.
You feel a little guilty, but these guys were hardly free of sin either. The blood of this day's murder is on your hands alone now, but you should be able to move on pretty quickly.
You're hailed by an angry Slug captain. "God damn Ghosssstssss! The nebulae are OURSSSSS! I had enough issssuesss to deal with, I can't deal with a Federation ship here too."
Show them that you aren't messing around.
"Sssshould have known you'd try thisss. Better I desssstroy your ssship than the Ghossstsss claim it themssselvesss."
Continue...
Assure them you're leaving.
"Fine... But don't let me sssee you back here."
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
An abandoned wreck, lights off and seemingly-empty, drifts nearby. It doesn't respond to your hails.
Scrap it.
Blast the ship into oblivion.

You send a shot directly into the hull of the wreck, causing an explosion to erupt that sends warped metal flying. Ghosts aboard or not, it doesn't matter anymore. Unfortunately, with the debris scattered into the depths of the nebula, nothing salveagable remains.
Ignore the ship.
During the salvage mission, the ship unexpectedly flickers to life! The Ghost crew stir to animation, awoken by your attempts at tearing apart their newly-earned home.
Continue...
The ship remains lifeless as you break down the hull.
You intend to ignore the wreck, but it appears the Ghosts aboard intend to fight you! The ship stirs to life and its weapons come online, leaving you with only one choice; to fight.
Continue...
If there are Ghosts aboard, you have no interest in waking them. You decide to spend your time on something else.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

You're hailed by the Rock ship at this beacon as soon as you jump in. Their crew are curled up on the ground, rocking back and forth. The captain shakes the camera violently, yelling at you. "GHOOOOSTS, GHOOOOOOOSTS! ARE YOU A GHOST?"
Absolutely.
No.
(Ghost Crew) Show them your Ghost crew.
The Rockman begins shrieking and smashes the camera. It doesn't take long until their weapons are live and the insane Rock crew is ready to destroy you.
Continue...
The captain shrivels over in fear and begs you not to eat their stomachs. You don't believe the Ghosts are carnivorous at all, but the Rockmen clearly don't know that.
We're gonna eat you.
The Rockman begins to cry. "No no no no, no, NO!" He slams his fist on the table in front of him and orders his psychotic crew to pull themselves together and attack.
Continue...
We mean you no harm.
"Oh thank you, thank you thank you thank you..." The captain crumples into a crying heap, mumbling thank you's and other incoherent ramblings. You leave them be.

"You... You are not Ghosts? I do not believe it! We have encountered only hell-spawn here, so it is clear that only demons inhabit this sector!" You don't bother explaining that by their logic they would be Ghosts as well, because their weapons are live.
Continue...
"Good good good, good... good. You be careful, the Ghosts, they're everywhere!" The Rockman bursts in a fit of psychotic laughter and ends the call. You put some distance between your two ships.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

The Rockman lets out a scream so high pitched you didn't think it was even possible for vocal cords to make. Suddenly, he falls over, twitches, and literally dies. Your Ghost must have given him a heart attack, if Rockmen even have hearts. With the rest of their crew too insane to do anything, you scrap the exterior of their ship.
The beacon appears empty, but you reconsider as footsteps echo through your halls. You rush to the engine room to see 3 Ghosts bent over, examining the FTL drive.
Fight the Ghosts before they can damage your system.
Wait and see.

You wait and watch the Ghosts as they look over every inch of your system. Though they have no visible tools, you wonder if they're taking measurements. One of the Ghosts tinkers with the mechanism in the system, then just as suddenly as they appeared the Ghosts walk out the door and disappear. You don't know what they've done, but it almost seems as if your engines are running at higher capacity than before.

You wait and watch the Ghosts as they look over every inch of your system. Suddenly, in a violent motion, one of the Ghosts tears off a metal covering on the Multiverse drive casing, resulting in a violent explosion! You don't wait any longer and order the crew to attack.

Looks like an Orchid ship, of all things, is the source of this distress beacon. One of their crew hail you - "Please help! We were sent by the Gathering to negotiate with one of the Goul clans who keep burning our colonies, but our captain was taken hostage and they won't give him back!"
Agree to help.

You follow the Orchid ship's directions to a Vagabond war camp populated mostly by Gouls. You request to speak with their leader directly: "Does the life of this frail plant thing concern you to a degree that would drive further ambitions to seek our favor in release? If you wish for this floral being not to suffer any longer, then you must prove your worth and destroy a Dynasty vessel who has been troubling my people."
We'll fight the Dynasty ship.
The Vagabonds direct you to a Dynasty vessel not too far. Prepare for battle!
Continue...
Refuse - just attack the Vagabonds instead.
"Predictable as always! Don't expect the life of this Orchid to persist much longer after this battle!"
Continue...
(Goul Crew) Negotiate with them.

The two Gouls speak back and forth for some time, but finally reach a consensus. Having frightened them with foreboding warnings of a potential Orchid invasion in collaboration with the Dynasty, the Gouls don't seem eager to keep the Orchid hostage any longer. Once safely returned, the Orchids pay you for your assistance.
Decline.
You apologize to the Orchids, but these aren't matters for you to get involved in.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
A poorly-armed civilian ship is emitting the distress beacon. Lost and afraid, they request you escort them to their destination and protect them from the Ghosts.
Accept.
The civilians thank you, and pay you some scrap as a down-payment. They promise there will be more at their final destination.
Attack.
The civilians are surprised by your sudden hostility, but have no choice but to fight.
Continue...
Refuse.
We don't have time to help every civilian dumb enough to wander into the Ghost nebula. You turn down their request and charge the FTL drive.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
You arrive at your desination, but a Ghost ship is already here. You signal for the civilians to stand back while you eliminate the threat.
Continue...
The civilians thank you for your help, and pay you the rest of the scrap.

"Identity of Federation vessel confirmed. It is implied your allegiance promotes your ability to assist. Currently at large: Separatist Saboteur 'B0N-N3' and Wraith Outlaw 'Clydeo'. Have eluded capture from Harmony for too long. Request: Federation vessel holds off criminals until Engi reinforcements can arrive. Is this deal acceptable?"
Accept.

"Transfering coordinates. Should your vessel fail at forcing the outlaws into surrender but still manage to eliminate them, alternative, though lesser, pay will be given. Top priority of Harmony: making sure further sabotage attempts by Separatists are unsuccessful."
Decline.
The Engi hang up without another word. You know that their robotic nature and stricter culture leads to customs you might consider abrupt, but must they be so rude?
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

A fairly large Separatist vessel is nearby, confirming that this is the correct location. Your approach seems to have alarmed the outlaws. "Say, Bonbon, does that Federation vessel strike you as out of place?" "Your assumptions are [correct]. This Federation vessel has -recently- been in contact with [Harmony] owned vessels. Your suspicions of malcontent are [justified]."
Do what you came here to do.
If you remember correctly, you were told by the Engi not to kill these guys if you can. You'll have to wait for the Engi to arrive or force them to surrender!
Continue...
Offer to shelter them from the Harmony.

"You wouldn't be able to do shit to help us! We're outlaws, the Federation don't want none o' us! We ain't just some normal criminals, we're fightin for the liberation of bon's people! Leave us be or do what you gotta do, I ain't dilly dallying."
Fight them.
If you remember correctly, you were told by the Engi not to kill these guys if you can. You'll have to wait for the Engi to arrive or force them to surrender!
Continue...
Leave them be.
As you start to depart, you're stopped again by the outlaws. "You ain't going to destroy us? Why? The Harmony not paying you enough?"
We aren't puppets to the Harmony. We're Multiverse Renegades. We enforce the law as we see fit.
"Vigilantes? Who woulda thunk it-" The outlaw is suddenly cut off by gunfire as a Harmony ship jumps in. Looks like reinforcements arrived sooner than expected!
Pretend you did your job and take the pay.

Once the outlaws have been captured, the Harmony ship contacts you again. "The Federation vessel has proven instrumental. Delaying outlaws raised chances of success by 75%. It is likely the Harmony will be requesting your assistance again."
Defend the outlaws.
You've heard the stories of the way the Harmony treats the Separatists. The Engi might be the Federation's allies, but that doesn't mean you can't stand against them.
Continue...
Conflict was not on my mind today.
"Hmmm. You're an awfully strange buncha mercenaries..."
They're onto us. Leave.
It's not a good idea to go through with this when they've already called you out. You slink away into the distant nebulas far away from the beacon.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
This beacon contains an immense amount of pollution, with various chunks of debris stuck in its orbit. Even outside of the planet is a concerningly large concentration of trash.
Try and pick up some of the debris.
You start to collect the scrap when you're stopped by a Vagabond ship. "Halt! All that which is not living and enters the bounds of this orbit is that which belongs to our lord, the trash king!"
The Trash King?

"Do not tell us you have not caught word of the trash king's rule!" When their cry is met by a blank stare on your end, the Ghost seems to deflate. "Alright. Follow me." The Ghost leads you to a massive castle built entirely out of garbage, and into a grand throne room.
Continue...
You are met by a large Mare Alpha wearing a paper mache crown that barely manages to stay on his gaseous 'head'. "I, am the trash king! Bow before me breathers!"
Bow.
"Good. You please me. If you are wishing to leave this place hands full of my precious trash, you must prove thineself in gladiatorial combat!"
Fight one of his strongest ships.
"A challenge! So let it be! Call forth my champions!" The trash king ushers for one of his strongest ships to fight you.
Continue...
Fight one of his weaker ships.
"A challenge! So let it be!" The trash king ushers for one of his vessels to fight you.
Continue...
No thanks.
Refuse.
The trash king growls. "I said BOW!"
Bow.
"Good. You please me. If you are wishing to leave this place hands full of my precious trash, you must prove thineself in gladiatorial combat!"
Fight one of his strongest ships.
"A challenge! So let it be! Call forth my champions!" The trash king ushers for one of his strongest ships to fight you.
Continue...
Fight one of his weaker ships.
"A challenge! So let it be!" The trash king ushers for one of his vessels to fight you.
Continue...
No thanks.
Don't tell us what to do!
You arm the weapons and attack the Ghosts.
Continue...
Avoid the debris.
You content yourself with watching the Ghosts scurry about as you do something onboard the ship. You can't help but notice, however, that the clouds in the distance seem to be approaching fast...
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

This beacon might not be near any immediate nebulas other than those far off in the north, but it does have a large Vagabond camp set up on the nearby planet. Brief scans show the inhabitants are moving about quickly.
Approach.

You're undisturbed by the Ghosts as you land on the planet, but as you approach the camp one of them stops you. "Why have you come? The great northern storm drifts closer every minute! Their electric fields will decimate our computers. We advise you leave at once!"
Leave.
Offer to stay and help move their equipment.

"You wish to help? Then we will not impede you - so long as you understand the risk." You order your crew to start dragging the various equipment, like moisture farms, solar panels, and an express coffee maker, indoors. The Ghosts weren't lying either, you can see the clouds moving closer at a concerning rate.
Take cover indoors!

Your crew hurry inside the shelter set up by the Ghosts. The storm eventually envelops the entire planet, and for almost an entire day you're stuck inside with the foul scented Ghosts. Still, they couldn't be happier to have you as their guests. When the storm eventually does clear, they give you one of their finest weapons as a gift.
Keep working!

You order the crew to keep working, even as most of the Ghosts retreat inside. By the time the clouds consume the planet, trapping you in total darkness, you stumble your way into the shelter but notice one of your crew is missing! You're stuck inside for almost a day with the Ghosts, who at least prove to be charismatic hosts.
Continue...

When you're finally free, you search everywhere for your crew but can't find them. Looks like they're gone for good. Their sacrifice wasn't entirely in vain however, as your efforts saved the Ghosts most of their vital equipment. Knowing the toll the day has had on you, they offer a large amount of scrap and one of their finest weapons.
If your crew are dead, it hardly matters. The Clone Bay would have been powered off by the storm and unable to clone them regardless.
Back to the ship!

This storm is going to be devastating, and you can't risk being stuck in it. Unfortunately, you're too late. A powerful shockwave strikes your ship, crippling the engines and causing an electrical fire. Even worse, looks like a Dynasty ship, forced all the way out here by the storm's movement, is here as well now!
Continue...
Hail the camp first.

You receive only a brief response from the Ghosts. "A storm approaches fast. It is imperative we relocate. It is advisable you leave soon." You aren't so sure about the legitimacy of this claim, but you won't be able to do much else with the Ghosts here anyways.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
Stay away.
You content yourself with watching the Ghosts scurry about as you do something onboard the ship. You can't help but notice, however, that the clouds in the distance seem to be approaching fast...
Check the storage.
Do nothing.

A Rebel ship already occupies this beacon, but surprisingly they hail you instead of fighting. "I should attack you... but this sector is littered with Ghosts and we've finally caught a break from the clouds."
Agree to leave them alone.
"Good, glad to see we can both agree on something." You sense it's awkward for the both of you to be here, but you decide to take your mind off it by doing something else.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
Screw a truce, kill them.
The Rebel captain yells at you as you both prepare for combat, "This is why the Federation must fall!"
Continue...
Pay them to delay the fleet.
The Rebel captain isn't sure how to respond, but it's clear he doesn't want to turn down the scrap. Reluctantly he accepts, and promises to give the fleet false information when they return.
A Rebel Marauder, painted white with a strange logo on the back, hails you. "Greetings, traveler! We are the Ghost... uh... Spook Chasers! We have a unique proposition for you..."
Listen.

"Maybe you've heard of the Dynasty's scuffle with the Rebellion? Well, it all went down when they took out one of the Rebels' first Flagship prototypes! This instigated a large scale war, and bla bla bla... Thing is, that Flagship is still around! In fact, it's in this very sector!"
Continue...

"Now, you're probably thinking we're some Rebels. Wrong! Used to roll with that pack, but we ain't any more. We're mercenaries, and we were sent by the Federation to take out this goliath. Turns out it's in the hands of the Vagabonds now - more specifically a clan called the Haunts, led by some jackass who calls himself Goziodeon. Help us take out these sons o' bitches, and we'll split the bounty half and half. Deal?"
Agree.
"Perfect! We'll transfer the last known co-ordinates of the ship. See you there."
Refuse.
The captain mutters something under his breath. "Fine, we'll find some other ship who's willing to kill some silly ship in return for the largest bounty ever made in galactic history!"
A Rebel ship is a Rebel ship. Attack!
The only good Rebel is a dead Rebel. You prepare to attack.
Continue...
Ignore them.
You don't care to deal with wackos, especially out here. You hear the captain sigh as you end the call.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
As the ship explodes, you feel a menacing presence as hundreds of whispy shapes float out of the hull. You've probably done something really bad, but what does one cursed timeline mean anyways?
You arrive at the beacon, but there is seemingly no ship here. You stare long into the clouds and catch the sight of an orange tail-wing slipping through.
Follow it.

You slip through the nebulas after it, only to find a massive gap in the clouds where there resides, right in the center, the old Rebel Flagship. "Good, good, you made it! Now give us a hand, would you?", shout the Spook Chasers, as they fire on the Flagship to no avail.
Help them!
You're no coward. If you want to have any hope of defeating a real, multiverse traveling Flagship at the end of this mission, you should be able to take this one out as well.
Continue...
Run.

The gargantuan ship, for which you've heard so many legends about, finally gives one last quake before an explosion in the engines causes it to erupt into flames and explode. The Flagship, and the Vagabonds with it, is dead... yet again.
Continue...

The Ghost Hunter hails you. "That. Was. LEGENDARY! Do you know how rich we're gonna be? Wait, yes yes. Your payment. Considering the bounty from this will be enough for us to buy an entire moon, maybe even a small planet, I suppose it doesn't hurt to give you something extra-special. We have a new cruiser that we've been working on, and I couldn't think of anyone else more worthy of piloting it than you."
Continue...

"Oh, oh! One last thing. With this we'll never have to work another day in our lives. It does me no harm to pass this onto you now. More members of the haunt still roam this galaxy, and you're as good a choice as any to take the rest of them out!"
